    • Constructor Detail

        public Builder()

    • Method Detail

      • retryLimit

        public RetryingExecutor.Builder retryLimit(int count)
        Maximum number of retrying.

      • initialRetryWait

        public RetryingExecutor.Builder initialRetryWait(int msec)
        The wait time in millisecond for the first retrying.

      • maxRetryWait

        public RetryingExecutor.Builder maxRetryWait(int msec)
        Maximum wait time in millisecond for retrying.

      • waitGrowRate

        public RetryingExecutor.Builder waitGrowRate(double rate)
        Rate to increase wait interval for each retrying. A retrying waits for previous waiting time multiplied by this rate, with the cap of maxRetryWait. Default is 2.0.

      • giveupTimeout

        public RetryingExecutor.Builder giveupTimeout(long msec)
        The duration in millisecond to giveup retrying. Retrying stops when number of retrying exceeds retryLimit, or total duration from the starting of initial run exceeds giveupTimeout.
        Default is 0, which disables giveup by timeout.

      • retryIf

        public RetryingExecutor.Builder retryIf(java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Exception> predicate)
        Function to decide whether a thrown exception is retryable not. RetryingExecutor retries only when this function returns true. Default function always returns true.

      • onRetry

        public RetryingExecutor.Builder onRetry(RetryingExecutor.RetryAction hook)
        A hook function that is called when retrying happens. This hook is useful to show a log message. Example: String.format("Retrying an execution (%d/%d): %s", retryCount, retryLimit, exception)

      • onGiveup

        public RetryingExecutor.Builder onGiveup(RetryingExecutor.GiveupAction override)
        A function that is called when retrying is given up. This function is useful to throw a custom exception. If this function is not set, RetryGiveupException is thrown with the exception thrown when the first execution fails.

      • build

        public RetryingExecutor build()
        Creates a new RetryingExecutor.
